market_summary: XRP at $1.36 (+7.0%) amid extreme fear environment (F&G: 8). ETF outflows persist with -$2.6K daily flow, while RLUSD circulation holds steady at $1.56B.
thesis_pulse: Thesis tracking despite market stress. RLUSD at 31% of kill switch target ($1.56B/$5B), XRP ETFs at 22% ($1.1B/$5B). China blacklisting Japanese shipbuilders escalates trade tensions, adding pressure to Japan stress thesis. ETF outflows slowing but still negative at -$2.6K daily vs -$5.5M weekly prior. Core infrastructure metrics intact but macro headwinds intensifying.

stress_assessment.interpretation: USD/JPY at 154.62 approaches critical 155 threshold. JGB yields at 2.24% well above critical 2% level signal BOJ credibility stress. Extreme fear (F&G: 8) indicates broad market distress.

scorecard_updates.reasoning: Stress metrics unchanged: USD/JPY 154.62 near critical, JGB 2.24% elevated, extreme fear persists

alerts.message: China blacklists Japanese shipbuilders - escalating trade tensions add pressure to Japan stress thesis
USD/JPY at 154.62 approaching critical 155 threshold - monitor for BOJ intervention signals

etf_analysis: ETF outflows slowing but persistent at -$2.6K daily vs severe -$5.5M weekly prior. Total AUM holding at $1.1B with no major fund activity.
macro_analysis: Stress environment intensifying: USD/JPY 154.62 near critical 155, JGB yields 2.24% well above stress threshold, extreme fear (8) signals broad deleveraging.

events_draft.title: China Blacklists Japanese Shipbuilders
events_draft.expanded: Export control escalation adds trade pressure on Japan amid existing yen weakness and JGB yield stress. Reinforces thesis stress environment.

geopolitical_watchlist.status_text: USD/JPY 154.62 near critical 155 intervention zone, JGB yields 2.24% signal credibility stress.
Brent at $69.77 stable, Hormuz tensions contained but dual carrier presence persists.
China blacklists Japanese shipbuilders in export control escalation, pressure building on allied supply chains.
Section 122 tariffs ongoing, ~145 days remaining on 150-day emergency authority.
No new escalation signals, energy flows stable through non-Arctic routes.

energy_interpretation: Brent crude stable at $69.77 provides temporary relief to Japan trade deficit pressures. However, persistent yen weakness (154.62) and rising JGB yields (2.24%) indicate the energy-import cost feedback loop remains stressed despite contained oil prices.
thesis_pulse_assessment: Core metrics tracking: RLUSD at $1.56B (31% of target), XRP ETFs at $1.1B (22% of target). SBI bond launch validated Japan adoption thesis ahead of schedule. ETF outflows slowing but persistent at -$2.6K daily. China-Japan trade escalation adds macro pressure but institutional infrastructure buildout continues. Stress environment elevated but not terminal.
stress_interpretation: Composite stress at ELEVATED (82/100). USD/JPY 154.62 approaches critical 155 threshold for BOJ intervention. JGB yields 2.24% well above 2% stress level indicate central bank credibility under pressure. Extreme fear (F&G: 8) signals broad market distress but not panic.

bear_case.score_reasoning: Counter-thesis pressure increasing with China-Japan trade escalation adding to existing yen/JGB stress. ETF outflows slowing but persistent institutional retreat signal continues.

bear_case.bear_narrative: China blacklisting Japanese shipbuilders escalates trade pressure on Japan stress thesis while ETF outflows persist despite slowing. BIS Project Nexus remains credible bypass threat to XRPL bridge utility. Institutional confidence erosion continues amid extreme fear environment despite positive adoption signals.
